items.title: Google finally did it: AirDrop now works on Android!
items.summary: Quick Share is finally compatible with AirDrop, plus an early look at the Galaxy Buds 4 Pro and Samsungâ€™s take on Magic Cue.
items.body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BxklVyOdcwU This week, Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown discuss the bombshell news that Google has updated Quick Share to be compatible with Appleâ€™s AirDrop â€” without Appleâ€™s help. They also break down the leaked design and new â€œhead gestureâ€ features of the Samsung Galaxy Buds 4 Pro and analyze the new â€œNow Nudgesâ€ coming to One UI 8.5. The Authority Insights Podcast is a new weekly show from the Android Authority team hosted by Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown. In each episode, weâ€™ll break down the latest exclusive reports, app teardowns, and leaks from the Android Authority team.

items.title: 5 AI tools that can help you start and run an online business
items.summary: Get things done faster and cheaper.
items.body: Credit: Mitja Rutnik / Android Authority Thanks to AI, starting an online business has never been easier. Technology can dramatically speed things up in more areas than you can imagine, and it also lowers the cost of both starting and running a business. However, you need the right tools for the job. There are a lot of AI tools out there, but I want to highlight just five to give you an idea of whatâ€™s possible. These will help you in all phases of your business journey, from planning to launching a business and then managing certain aspects of it.

items.title: Copy that: Android 17 may add a â€˜Universal Clipboardâ€™ for Android PCs
items.summary: Copying Apple, Google is working on a Universal Clipboard for Android phones and PCs.
items.body: Android has a built-in clipboard that makes copying and pasting text or images in your favorite apps easy, but its contents arenâ€™t automatically synced across your devices. This means that transferring copied content between Android devices currently requires a third-party tool. Fortunately, that could change in next yearâ€™s Android 17 update, as weâ€™ve spotted evidence that Google is working on a â€˜ Universal Clipboard â€™ feature. Youâ€™re reading the Authority Insights Newsletter , a weekly newsletter that reveals some new facet of Android that hasnâ€™t been reported on anywhere else. If youâ€™re looking for the latest scoops, the hottest leaks, and breaking news on Googleâ€™s Android operating system and other mobile tech topics, then weâ€™ve got you covered.

items.title: England would be 'amateurish' to not play pink-ball warm-up - Vaughan
items.summary: It would be "amateurish" if England continue with their plan not to play in a pink-ball warm-up before the second Ashes Test, says former captain Michael Vaughan.

items.title: Watch Duro's spectacular overhead kick for Valencia
items.summary: Valencia's Hugo Duro scores a brilliant overhead kick winner against Levante in La Liga.

items.title: Bangladesh closing in on Test win over Ireland
items.summary: Harry Tector hits a half-century as Ireland push Bangladesh into the fifth day of their second Test in Mirpur.

items.title: Was Oxtoby's Northern Ireland tenure a success?
items.summary: After it was announced she would leave Northern Ireland to join Newcastle United, was Tanya Oxtoby's tenure as manager a success?

items.title: Vaughan confused by 'amateurish' England plans before second Test
items.summary: Former England Test captain Michael Vaughan believes England's players need to take part in the England Lions' pink-ball multi-day match to help prepare for the second Ashes Test against Australia in Brisbane, following a damaging eight-wicket defeat in the first Test in Perth.

items.title: Is OPPO trying to ruin OnePlus? Survey reveals a grim answer (for OnePlus)
items.summary: Whether it's intentional or unintentional, most polled readers think OPPO is ruining OnePlus.
items.body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority A few years ago, I questioned whether OPPO was trying to ruin OnePlus. Fast-forward to 2025 and Iâ€™m more convinced than ever that this is the case, as OnePlus follows up the excellent OnePlus 13 with the polarizing OnePlus 15 . This also comes after the OnePlus 10 Pro was followed by the OnePlus 11. I recently wrote an opinion piece outlining my admittedly crazy theory about the two companies. I also included a poll asking readers whether they thought OPPO was trying to ruin OnePlus. Well, the results are in, and hereâ€™s how you answered it.

items.title: This is how Google convinced me to pay for a more expensive Google One plan
items.summary: I would've never shelled out for Google AI Pro without this new perk.
items.body: As a longtime Gmail and Google Photos user, Iâ€™ve always had my eye on Google One subscription plans. For the better part of a decade, I tried just about anything to avoid paying up for Google One storage , pushing the free 15GB of cloud storage to its limit. Eventually, mass-deleting emails and photos to free up cloud storage space took its toll, and soon I found myself paying $2 a month for Google One Basic. That only solved my data cap problems for one Google account; not long after, I shelled out for Google One Premium to share 2TB of cloud storage across all my accounts. Subscriptions can get out of hand quickly, so Google One Premium at $10 per month was all I could muster. Despite owning multiple Nest displays and a Nest Video Doorbell, I stuck with only three hours of event recording to avoid paying another $10 for Nest Aware each month. Plus, my smart home is split between the Apple and Google ecosystems. Paying for Apple One gave me an unlimited number of HomeKit Secure Video (HSV) cameras with a 10-day recording history, making Nest Aware hard to justify.

items.title: The already affordable Google Pixel 9a is $100 off today!
items.summary: You would be surprised at how good this cheap phone is.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority If youâ€™re on the lookout for a new smartphone, the Google Pixel 9a might be just what you need. This phone is already a great deal for its retail price, but this Black Friday, you can snag it for only $399, down from $499. Thatâ€™s a solid 20% discount, and itâ€™s matching the lowest price itâ€™s been in the last month. Google Pixel 9a for $399 (20% off)

items.title: 'Inexcusable' - how 30 minutes cost England in first Ashes Test
items.summary: How 30 minutes of poor batting cost England in the first Ashes Test in Perth, opening the door for Australia to win inside two days.

items.title: This is why I stick with the default Pixel Launcher
items.summary: Google has brainwashed me into thinking this is all the functionality I need in a launcher.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Every year when I set up my new Pixel phone, I have a brief moment of doubt about sticking with the default Pixel Launcher. I think about all the great Android launchers Iâ€™ve tried in the past, all the interesting approaches to finding and interacting with my apps and widgets, and then I accept my fate and stick with the default option, again and again. Itâ€™s not that I think the Pixel Launcher is perfect or that the other options donâ€™t have excellent features I envy. Quite the contrary. But thereâ€™s something comforting in Googleâ€™s approach, so hereâ€™s why I stick with it despite knowing there are better options out there.

items.title: I just used my Pixel to AirDrop files to an iPhone, and it felt like magic
items.summary: Welcome to the future.
items.body: If you had told me a few days ago that on a random Thursday morning, Google would launch AirDrop support for its Pixel phones , I would have called you crazy. And yet, thatâ€™s exactly what happened this past week. On November 20, Google upgraded its Quick Share system so that Pixel 10 phones can send/receive files to and from any iPhone, iPad, or Mac over AirDrop. It sounds impossible, but itâ€™s realâ€” and shockingly easy to use.

items.title: 5 apps to use instead of Google Fit
items.summary: Depending on your fitness goals, Google Fit may be too basic for you.
items.body: Credit: Jimmy Westenberg / Android Authority Google Fit is a great app in many ways, but itâ€™s not for everyone. Iâ€™ve used it for a while and like the fact that I can see the steps I took on a daily basis and how those translate into actual distance. I can also track my weight, see how many calories Iâ€™ve burned, and review the history of my activities. However, the app is quite simple, as most Google apps are, so it lacks many features. There are no social features, so I canâ€™t follow what my friends have been up to on their fitness journeys. There are also no leaderboards, which some apps use to gamify the experience.

items.title: England taken apart as brutal Head gives Australia opening Ashes win
items.summary: England go down to a humbling defeat in the first Ashes Test after Travis Headâ€™s blistering century completes an astonishing Australia fightback in Perth.

items.title: Ashes player ratings: Which England players got 1/10?
items.summary: Chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt marks the performances of the Australia and England teams after the first Test in Perth.

items.title: 'Half chance' Australia captain Cummins will return for second Ashes Test
items.summary: Australia captain Pat Cummins says he could be fit to return for the second Ashes Test next month.

items.title: 'Top class' - Head scores century as  Australia beat England
items.summary: Travis Head reaches his tenth Test century off just 69 balls as Australia beat England inside two days in the first Ashes Test in Perth.

items.title: Swansea to appoint Matos as Maritimo confirm move
items.summary: Swansea City are close to appointing Vitor Matos as their new head coach as his current club Maritimo confirm his departure.

items.title: Noakes goes from railways and roofing to Riyadh title shot
items.summary: Sam Noakes has run marathons on a whim and was moved to stop his mother from contacting past opponents - now he fights for the WBO lightweight title.

items.title: Scotland fans caused 'small earthquake' in World Cup qualifier win
items.summary: Seismic activity was recorded as the Tartan Army celebrated Scotland reaching their first World Cup since 1998.

items.title: A look around Barcelona's new-look Nou Camp
items.summary: BBC Spanish football reporter Elizabeth Conway shows us around Barcelona's iconic Nou Camp. The stadium will reopen, after more than two years of renovation work, for a game against Athletic Club in La Liga on Saturday.

items.title: Nice guy Edwards out to prove he won't finish last with Wolves
items.summary: After 111 appearances as a player for Wolves, news manager Rob Edwards takes charge against Crystal Palace with the club battling for their Premier League lives.

items.title: 'Where has this come from?' - Pope, Brook & Root dismissed
items.summary: Scott Boland and Mitchell Starc take the three wickets of Ollie Pope, Harry Brook and Joe Root in the space of six balls as England fall to 76-5 on day two of the first Ashes Test in Perth.

items.title: Why it was always Arsenal for 'part-time barista' Saka
items.summary: England winger Bukayo Saka sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his love for Arsenal and living in his "coffee era".

items.title: North London derby is one of most beautiful games - Saka
items.summary: Bukayo Saka shares what it was like growing up as an Arsenal fan and what the north London derby means to him.

items.title: Starc takes catch off own bowling to remove Crawley for another duck
items.summary: England's second innings gets off to a familiar start as Mitchell Starc's "brilliant" diving catch dismisses Zak Crawley for a duck in the first over again on day two of the first Ashes Test in Perth.

items.title: England lead by 40 after taking final Australian wicket
items.summary: Ben Duckett takes the catch at gully to dismiss Nathan Lyon for four, as Australia are bowled out for 132 to give England a lead of 40 runs heading into the second innings on day two of the first Ashes Test in Perth.

items.title: Carpenter, Rolfo & Bartel feature in UWCL goals of week
items.summary: Strikes from Ellie Carpenter, Fridolina Rolfo and Julia Bartel all feature in the best goals of the week from the Women's Champions League.

items.title: World number one Thitikul three clear at Tour Championship
items.summary: World number one Jeeno Thitikul cards a nine-under-par 63 to open up a three-shot lead at the CME Group Tour Championship.

items.title: Wales aim to end 72 years of agony against All Blacks
items.summary: The history of matches between two nations that bleed rugby is almost a history of the game itself.

items.title: Littler wins as Van Veen comeback stuns Humphries
items.summary: Luke Littler wins his first match as world number one to progress at the Players Championship Finals, while Gian van Veen produces a stunning comeback to knock out Luke Humphries.

items.title: Man Utd might offload Fernandes - Saturday's gossip
items.summary: Manchester United might offload Bruno Fernandes to aid a summer rebuild, Barcelona are keen on Harry Kane, Real Madrid look at Angelo Stiller, plus more.

items.title: Hoffenheim controversially denied winner in draw at Mainz
items.summary: Watch highlights as struggling Mainz came from behind to draw against Hoffenheim in the Bundesliga.

Itâ€™s reported that â€œmassive numbersâ€ of blankets have reached stores across the country. The item is expected to show up on the T-Life app on December 2 or December 9. This week, we learned that the Apple TV â€œOn Usâ€ perk will no longer be fully free for T-Mobile customers. While youâ€™ll have to start paying for your previously free benefit, at least there havenâ€™t been any new changes to your T-Mobile Tuesday freebies. items.title: Apple TVâ€™s Black Friday offer will let you binge for 6 months at half price
items.summary: The perfect way to catch up on hit shows like Severance, Ted Lasso, and Pluribus.
items.body: TL;DR Apple TV is offering new and eligible returning subscribers a Black Friday promotion that cuts the monthly price by more than 50% for a limited time. Interested customers can snag six months of access for just $36, paying only $5.99 per month. Apple recently raised the regular price of Apple TV to $12.99 in August, making this Black Friday deal particularly sweet. Apple TV, the rebranded streaming service formerly known as Apple TV+, seems to have another hit in the viral Pluribus series. However, itâ€™s more expensive than ever to get started binging Apple TV titles. The streaming service hiked prices from $9.99 to $12.99 per month in August for new and existing subscribers. If you found those prices too expensive, Apple TVâ€™s limited-time Black Friday promotion slashes the streaming serviceâ€™s monthly price by more than half for six months. Itâ€™s available now for new and eligible returning subscribers, so interested customers should take advantage of it now.

items.title: Cobolli wins epic tie-break to send Italy into Davis Cup final
items.summary: Flavio Cobolli says sealing Italy's place in the Davis Cup final was "one of the best days of my life" after he saves seven match points to win a 32-point tie-break against Belgium's Zizou Bergs.

items.title: Dust off that GoldenEye cart: Analogue 3D orders are returning soon
items.summary: Orders reopen in just days â€” with one annoying change.
items.body: TL;DR Interested in picking up an Analogue 3D? Stock is set to return on Monday. Orders placed next week will begin shipping in early December. Analogue has raised the consoleâ€™s pricing from $250 to $270. One of the coolest things about being a retro gamer is that youâ€™ve got just so many different options for how to enjoy your favorite games. Letâ€™s say you want to play some Nintendo 64: You can sign up for Nintendo Switch Online and play your games there. If youâ€™d rather go a little more DIY with emulation, you can always install an N64 emulator on your phone. Or if youâ€™re me, youâ€™re wiring up an actual N64 console to your Sony PVM. If youâ€™d rather use a modern screen, though, you might want to check out the Analogue 3D â€” and weâ€™ve got some good news today for anyone interested in that (plus a little bad). Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Googleâ€™s new Pixel Studio-powered screenshot editor is starting to roll out
items.summary: It was first spotted in Android 16 QPR2 Beta 1, but it's now rolling out for Pixel users running the stable November update.
items.body: TL;DR Googleâ€™s updated Pixel screenshot editor, first tested as part of Android 16 QPR2 Beta 1, is now rolling out across stable channels. Android Authority spotted the new interface on multiple Google Pixel phones running the latest November 2025 update. The updated screenshot editor uses Pixel Studio, adding AI-powered editing and erasing while expanding markup and font options. Google previewed an advanced screenshot editor with a touch of AI in the first Android 16 QPR2 beta build in August, which uses Pixel Studio smarts for marking up, erasing, and resizing screenshots. Android 16 QPR2 is expected to release for stable channels sometime in December, but ahead of that release, weâ€™re seeing Pixelâ€™s new screenshot editor roll out for phones running the stable November 2025 update . When the new interface reaches your device, the screenshot editor will open in the Pixel Studio app, adding a wider suite of markup and editing tools. Android Authority spotted the new AI-powered screenshot editor on multiple Pixel phones running the stable November 2025 update. On our Google Pixel 9 Pro XL, the new editor appeared on Android 16 build number BP3A.251105.015. The new editor also relieâ€¦

items.summary: Motorola's next stylus-toting phone leaks.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Real-life images of the Moto G Stylus (2026) have leaked. The images reveal the deviceâ€™s design and a leather-textured back finish in a beige color. You can also see that it features a triple rear camera setup. As we approach the end of 2025, we canâ€™t help but think about whatâ€™s ahead for 2026. In regard to Motorola, weâ€™re getting a little taste of whatâ€™s to come through a new leak. This particular leak centers around the 2026 version of the Moto G Stylus . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google TV looks great at 300 inches thanks to this laser projector
items.summary: JMGO's latest arrives just in time to tempt your holiday budget.
items.body: TL;DR Previously launched in Europe, JMGOâ€™s N3 4K triple-laser projector just arrived for US shoppers. The device features built-in Google TV and boasts 1,800 ISO lumens brightness and 110% BT.2020 color coverage. The device is priced at $1,599 and is available now from Best Buy. Big-screen viewing keeps getting more accessible, and JMGOâ€™s latest effort leans into the trend. The companyâ€™s N3 brings full 4K triple-laser projection and a flexible gimbal stand to shoppersâ€™ living rooms, aiming to simplify setup without watering down performance. The model first rolled out in Europe earlier this year and is now making its way to the US market. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.body: TL;DR Google Photos overhauled its editor over the summer, but lost its perspective correction tool at the time. Google later confirmed its intention to bring that feature back. Itâ€™s still not publicly accessible, but we can confirm that code for the tool has returned to the app. Earlier this year, Google revamped the editing experience in Photos â€” and not everyone was a fan. While there was a fair amount to appreciate about the changes, we also lost some functionality in the process, and maybe top on that list of missing abilities was the appâ€™s tool for perspective correction. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.summary: Google gives Gemini interactive images for tap-to-learn education.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Gemini can now create interactive images. The new interactive images feature is designed to help users understand complex academic concepts. Clicking or tapping on a label in the interactive image opens a panel with definitions, explanations, and content about the topic. When it comes to education, sometimes you need more than just text and images to understand a concept. Having the ability to actively engage with a subject can go a long way in the learning process. Geminiâ€™s latest update focuses on this by introducing interactive images. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: The inevitable has happened: Ads on Google Searchâ€™s AI Mode are here (Update: Itâ€™s a test)
items.summary: Google Search AI Mode is starting to show ads for the first time.
items.body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority TL;DR Google has started monetizing Searchâ€™s AI Mode. Sponsored results now appear along with AI-generated responses. These ads appear at the bottom of a response. Update: November 21, 2025 (2:14 PM ET): A Google spokesperson has informed us that these ads appearing in the wild are part of a test. The test was initially announced at Google Marketing Live back in May. According to the spokesperson, Google has no new updates to share regarding the rollout of ads on AI Mode. Original article: November 21, 2025 (11:55 AM ET): Google has long been working on ways to monetize its various AI efforts, especially when it comes to Search. Not surprising when you know Search accounts for a big part of the companyâ€™s revenue. Weâ€™re starting to see this come to fruition with ads arriving on the previously ad-free AI Mode experience.

items.body: There are household appliances you can convince yourself you donâ€™t need. Sometimes, youâ€™re right â€” I mean, who needs a 9-in-1 coffeemaker, rice cooker, and ice cream machine? For a while, I even put robot vacuums into that same category. After all, as a dad of two cats in a one-bedroom apartment, I didnâ€™t think I had that much space to worry about. Besides, my traditional vacuum was doing just fine, even if I did have to grab a mop from my closet afterwards. Then, the Roborock Qrevo CurvX showed up, and it changed my tune. Between its ultra-thin design, powerful suction, and smart features that actually ensure that I donâ€™t have to keep a constant eye on it, itâ€™s pretty much taken over my home cleaning routine. Hereâ€™s how it made me a believer in robot vacuums and why you might want to consider one, too â€” especially with Black Friday just around the corner.

items.title: What makes the SATELLAI Collar better than the Halo Collar 5?
items.summary: We take a closer look at how two of the best GPS dog collars stack up.
items.body: A GPS dog collar is a handy tracking tool that lets you know where your pet is at all times, giving you peace of mind when they run off at the dog park, in an unfenced backyard, or on a trail. But the dog collars that stand out go even further, adding features like geofencing and even activity and health monitoring. We recently compared one of the best in the GPS dog collar segment, the SATELLAI Collar, with the Halo Collar 4 and SpotOn Collar . Halo released an updated version of its collar, the Halo Collar 5, with several improvements over its predecessor. But are they enough to take on the SATELLAI Collar ? We find out as we take a quick look at the SATELLAI Collar vs Halo Collar 5!

items.title: Nothing keeps its update promise as Android 16 lands on Phone 3, hereâ€™s whatâ€™s new
items.summary: AI widgets, upgraded multitasking, sleek glyph tricks, and more arrive with Nothing OS 4.0!
items.body: TL;DR Nothing OS 4.0, based on Android 16, is rolling out now for the Nothing Phone 3, with other models to follow soon. Key visual changes include â€œExtra Dark Mode,â€ minimalist icons, a simplified status bar design, and new lock screen clocks. New features include AI-generated widgets, expanded Glyph support for third-party apps, and dual-window multitasking. Android 16 publicly debuted in June, but users beyond Pixels and select Samsung Galaxy phones had to wait a while before the stable update landed on their phones. Nothing rolled out Nothing OS 4.0 open beta in October and promised that the stable update would land in November . True to its promise (down to the date, impressively), Nothing is now rolling out Android 16-based Nothing OS 4.0 to its phones, starting with the Nothing Phone 3. items.title: Google just went rogue with AirDrop, and Iâ€™m loving it!
items.summary: Bringing AirDrop support to Android without Apple's help reminds me of Google's "donâ€™t be evil" era, and I hope it sticks.
items.body: Opinion post by Adamya Sharma Thank you, thank you so very much, Google! If there was one feature I was truly manifesting for my Pixel 10 Pro (or any Android phone for that matter), it was proper AirDrop support between iPhones, Android devices, Macs, and iPads . As someone who works for an Android website yet also nibbles on the forbidden fruit, I have shed actual tears trying to move files between my Android phone, MacBook, and iPhone. Iâ€™m WhatsApping images to myself like itâ€™s 2015, emailing documents like itâ€™s 2007, digging out cables like Iâ€™m on a treasure hunt, all for something as basic as transferring files. If it were up to Apple, I and many others like me might never have seen this day. But thanks to Google going delightfully rogue and doing one of the coolest things for Android this year, my hacky file-transfer misery might finally be behind meâ€¦ at least until Apple decides this tiny moment of cross-platform joy has gone on long enough.

items.title: Phone by Google could soon let you scream â€˜Urgentâ€™ before a call
items.summary: It could be a boon if your friends never pick up your call. Just pray you're not that friend.

Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Google is developing a new calling feature that would allow you to mark your calls as Urgent using the Phone app. Callers might be able to add a short message along with an emoji to make their call appear important. The feature would also override the recipientâ€™s DND settings, reducing the likelihood of the call being missed. Googleâ€™s Phone app offers a host of nifty features, including Spam Rejection and Call Screen, that let you fend off spammers and keep unwanted calls at bay. However, it may be now be working on a feature that could allow urgent calls to reach you, even when you might not be in the mood for talking. items.title: OnePlus ditched the alert slider, and I donâ€™t like its AI replacement
items.summary: Maybe Mind Space will improve, but I'm disappointed so far.
items.body: When you think of a OnePlus phone, what do you think of? Well, you probably think of its red charging cable, its black sandstone finish, and, for a while, its Hasselblad-tuned camera setup. One thing you also probably thought of for a long, long time was its iconic alert slider â€” a three-stop switch to go from ring to silent without ever unlocking your phone. Then, that alert slider disappeared. No, not on the OnePlus 15 (yet), but on the OnePlus 10T. The change made exactly nobody happy, so OnePlus brought its slider back. Now, though, itâ€™s gone again, this time from the OnePlus 15 , making it a much more noticeable problem. In its place sits the Plus Key, a multifunctional button with a new AI-powered journal at its disposal, and I donâ€™t like it one bit.

Googleâ€™s Pixel 10 is the first Android device to officially bridge Quick Share and AirDrop. Users must still manually enable AirDropâ€™s â€œEveryone for 10 minutesâ€ setting on the iPhone side. In a move that could put pressure on Android OEMs everywhere, Nothing is preparing to bring cross-platform file-sharing support â€” specifically compatibility with Quick Shareâ€™s newly revealed ability to interoperate with AirDrop â€” to its smartphones. items.title: Hereâ€™s how you can AirDrop files from your Pixel to an iPhone using Quick Share
items.summary: Google did the impossible.
items.body: For years, one of the main draws to the Apple ecosystem has been AirDrop. Being able to seamlessly send photos, documents, and other files to Apple devices with just a tap has long been one of the iPhoneâ€™s biggest perks. Last year, Google finally released its answer to AirDrop, Quick Share, giving Android devices their own seamless sharing system. Now, for the first time ever, Google has done the unthinkable and brought AirDrop and Quick Share together . No longer is Quick Share limited to sending files to other Android devices â€” it can now send files just as easily to iPhones and other Apple gadgets via AirDrop.

items.summary: ARMSX2 might be the new PS2 emulator on the block, but it's getting a big feature that's missing from NetherSX2.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR The team behind the ARMSX2 PS2 emulator for Android has revealed that the app will soon get online multiplayer support. This would be a major addition as a variety of PS2 games supported online play, including Madden titles, the SOCOM franchise, and more. The team also confirmed that itâ€™s working on a PS1 emulator thatâ€™s actually a fork of an existing effort. ARMSX2 is the newest PlayStation 2 emulator on Android, and the hope is that it will eventually surpass AetherSX2/NetherSX2 as the best PS2 emulator on the platform. Now, the team behind the nascent emulator has revealed that a major feature is on the way. The ARMSX2 team confirmed on Discord that the PS2 emulator will soon get online multiplayer support. This is a big deal as AetherSX2 and NetherSX2 donâ€™t support online play.

Premium users will also soon see new features, including â€˜SongDNAâ€™ and â€˜About the songâ€™, offering deeper insights into track creators and musical connections. Thanks to the ever-increasing prices of music streaming services and the occasional introduction of new features, many people are interested in switching between services like Spotify , YouTube Music, and Apple Music. Users have had to resort to third-party tools to migrate between services, but lately, these platforms have made it easier for users to hop on and bring their playlists along. items.title: After 10 years, Google Photos may be getting this basic UI feature
items.summary: What took you so long, Google?
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google Photos may soon have a new display option for the built-in image editor. Google is experimenting with a light theme in the image editor inside the Photos app. While the editor has existed for over a decade â€” parallel to Google Photos â€” it has always had a dark theme, with no option to switch. Google Photos has been around for over a decade and has offered a built-in photo editor throughout that duration. Even though its native photo editor wasnâ€™t initially as sophisticated as Google Snapseed â€” it only received advanced editing features in 2020 â€” and did not have AI-backed editing chops until recently, one trait has always remained constant. That is the background color of the editor interface, which has always been dark gray. Now, Google appears to have finally meditated on it and might be working to add a new light theme.

items.title: Google Tasks could soon give you a better way to sort tasks (APK teardown)
items.summary: You'll soon have a very useful sorting option for your tasks.
items.body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR An Android Authority teardown has revealed that Google Tasks could soon let you sort tasks by deadline. The tasks would be sorted from earliest to latest deadline. This would join other sorting options like date, title, and custom sorting order. It took a while, but Google Tasks finally gained a deadline feature a few days ago. Now, weâ€™ve discovered that Google could offer another nifty deadline-related feature in Tasks. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. Subscribe to our new Authority Insights newsletter for more exclusive reports, app teardowns, leaks, and in-depth tech coverage you won't find anywhere else. sign up now By signing up, you agree to our Terms of Use and acknowledge the data practices in our Privacy Policy. You may unsubscribe at any time. We conducted a teardown of the Google Tasks app for Android (2025.11.17.833092473.0-release) and enabled the ability to sort tasks by deadline. Check out our screenshots below.

items.title: Googleâ€™s AirDrop integration isnâ€™t just one-way, iPhones can beam files to Android too
items.summary: Pixel 10 users can also receive AirDrops from iPhones without any hacks.
items.body: TL;DR Androidâ€™s new Quick Share update doesnâ€™t just send files to iPhones; it also receives AirDropped files from iPhones. We confirmed that Pixel 10 devices appear in the AirDrop list once you enable Everyone for 10 minutes or tap â€˜Receiveâ€™ in Quick Share on your Android phone. Google says the feature uses a direct, secure peer-to-peer connection and plans to expand support beyond the Pixel 10 series. Googleâ€™s new Quick Share update doesnâ€™t just let Android users send files to iPhones using AirDrop. Weâ€™ve confirmed that AirDrop can also now send files from an iPhone directly to a Pixel 10 as well, bringing true cross-platform sharing to the table. So if your friend has an iPhone, they can follow the exact same AirDrop steps they would use to send a file to another Apple device. Your Pixel 10 will show up in their AirDrop list, and the transfer goes through normally.

items.title: Skip the giant TV, these Roku TV projectors are on sale for Black Friday
items.summary: Movie night just got more affordable.
items.body: If youâ€™ve been daydreaming about a home theater setup but donâ€™t want a giant TV overtaking your living room, Black Friday is the time to shop. Among the projectors currently hitting steep discounts, Aurzenâ€™s compact Roku TV projectors are down to some of their best prices of the year. More importantly, both models currently on sale deliver far more portability than a wall-mounted behemoth. Aim either at a blank wall, and youâ€™re all set for holiday movie nights. Aurzen EAZZE D1R At an approachable price point, the EAZZE D1R features built-in Roku TV for straightforward streaming without any extra hardware. It also packs 1080p resolution and Dolby Audio, plus auto focus and auto keystone for near-instant setup. Brightness lands at 280 ANSI lumens, which is solid for dark or evening viewing, and projection can stretch from 60 to 150 inches. That range should be more than ample for movies, gaming, or turning your space into an aggressively cozy virtual fireplace. Dual-band Wi-Fi and Bluetooth round out the essentials. Itâ€™s an easy win for anyone wanting a plug-and-play projector that wonâ€™t dominate the room or the budget.

items.title: Perplexityâ€™s AI-powered Comet browser is finally ready for Android users to try
items.summary: Will Perplexity's AI tech be enough to draw you away from Chrome and Gemini?
items.body: TL;DR Perplexity has just made its AI-powered Comet browser available for Android. Public access arrives just two weeks after early access first opened. Comet offers full voice support for interacting with Perplexity. Right now, companies are putting AI in everything â€” for better or for worse. And while we donâ€™t have to look far to find some particularly ridiculous solutions itâ€™s been shoehorned into, weâ€™ve quickly come to realize that AI in a web browser makes a lot of sense. As a result, lots of companies have been developing their own solutions, and earlier this year we checked out Perplexityâ€™s Comet browser for desktop PCs. Ever since, weâ€™ve been looking forward to getting to use Comet on Android â€” and now, the floodgates are finally opening. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Oura wants to take Samsung to court over the Galaxy Ring
items.summary: Oura is ready for a legal battle with Samsung, Reebok, and others.
items.body: Credit: Kaitlyn Cimino / Android Authority TL;DR Oura has filed a preemptive lawsuit against Samsung, Reebok (Reebok Smart Ring), Zepp Health (Amazfit ring), and Nexxbase (Luna ring). The smart ring company argues that these brands infringed on several of its patents. These patents relate to form factor, internal and external components, and manufacturing methods. Samsung entered the wearable market last year with the launch of the Galaxy Ring . With the tech giantâ€™s weight behind it, the Galaxy Ring immediately became one of the Oura Ringâ€™s biggest rivals. Now, Oura is taking the steps to sue Samsung over its Galaxy Ring. And it looks like Samsung isnâ€™t the only brand Oura has its eyes on. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

Brand-new products usually take a while to go on sale, but Amazon finally caved in with its Black Friday sales. Both are available at a discounted rate for the first time! items.title: Motorola might already sell a phone in Pantoneâ€™s 2026 Color of the Year
items.summary: This might be Pantone's 2026 Color of the Year, and Motorola knows it well.
items.body: TL;DR Reliable leaker Evan Blass claims to know the Pantone 2026 Color of the Year, and itâ€™s a color Motorola already uses. Blass correctly predicted Pantoneâ€™s 2025 Color of the Year ahead of its official announcement, which is expected to come next month for the 2026 iteration. If this is the Pantone 2026 Color of the Year, Motorola could still release a limited-edition colorway of it for other Android phone models. Motorola and Pantone have a running partnership thatâ€™s one of the more fascinating Android phone collaborations. Pantone, the color naming and validation company, works with Motorola to validate the displays and cameras on select smartphones. The two brands also team up to deliver exclusive phone colorways, and weâ€™ve seen Pantone-colored Motorola phones since 2022. Pantone picks a â€œColor of the Yearâ€ annually, and Motorola releases a special edition of a phone in that color. This time, Pantoneâ€™s 2026 Color of the year may have leaked, and thereâ€™s a twist.

items.title: T-Mobile is giving customers DoorDash memberships and free pie in time for Thanksgiving

items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is bringing back the free DoorDash DashPass promo for existing customers. The DashPass offer opens next Tuesday and is available for only one week. Customers who redeem the offer will also receive a free pie with their next DoorDash grocery order ($12 minimum). Today, T-Mobile unveiled a new â€œSwitching Made Easyâ€ program, which lets you sign up directly for T-Mobile services without the need to talk to a rep at all . While this is all good for new customers, what about existing users? The good news is you arenâ€™t being left out, as T-Mobile is giving folks another chance to get a free DashPass by DoorDash membership in time for Thanksgiving. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: T-Mobile promises switching is about to get easier, but is this just a PR spin?
items.summary: Switching is now possible completely online with AI help, but is this really better?
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile announced a new â€œSwitching Made Easyâ€ system that lets customers switch and sign up through the T-Life app in about 15 minutes without needing store representatives. The carrier is adding same-day DoorDash delivery for new devices and allowing customers to switch first and decide on new phones later. The new digital switching process launches today as part of T-Mobileâ€™s broader push to expand T-Life and streamline customer onboarding. Last week, we reported on rumors that T-Mobile would soon have a big staff meeting to discuss some upcoming changes. At the time, it was uncertain what would be announced. As it turns out, the internal meeting was likely meant to foreshadow bigger plans from the company. T-Mobile took to Vegas to unveil its plans to â€œunleash the un-carrierâ€. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Not just iPhones: Googleâ€™s Quick Share works with AirDrop on Macs and iPads, too
items.summary: Yes, Quick Share will work with AirDrop on MacBooks and iPads, too.
items.body: TL;DR Google recently announced that Quick Share now works with AirDrop. The feature supports iPad and macOS devices, in addition to the iPhone. The new functionality is currently only available for the Pixel 10 series. Google dropped a big surprise on us today with the announcement that Pixel phones and iPhones can finally share files seamlessly, with Quick Share now working with AirDrop. Google has since confirmed to Android Authority that this development was entirely through its own implementation, with no assistance from Apple. While the announcement mentions Android and iPhone users, the functionality expands to Appleâ€™s other devices as well. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Androidâ€™s clever Quick Share AirDrop solution still has this one big limitation
items.summary: AirDrop is working with Android Quick Share, but you can't use it with iPhones set to "Contacts Only" reception.
items.body: TL;DR Google just made Android Quick Share work with Apple AirDrop on Pixel 10 phones. The solution only works for iPhones using AirDropâ€™s â€œEveryone for 10 Minutesâ€ receiving mode. Google says that it would love to work with Apple to get AirDropâ€™s â€œContacts Onlyâ€ mode working with Android. Google just made history today, knocking down another wall between mobile platforms as it enabled easy Android-to-iOS file sharing by building AirDrop compatibility into Android Quick Share . Itâ€™s not just a huge quality-of-life improvement for Android users, but also a not-insignificant technological achievement as we learn that Google achieved this feat without Appleâ€™s help . items.title: PSA: Youâ€™ll need this new app to make Quick Share compatible with AirDrop

items.body: TL;DR Quick Share is finally compatible with AirDrop, allowing file transfers between Android and Apple devices. The feature is rolling out first to the Pixel 10 series and requires the new â€œQuick Share extensionâ€ app. It works natively without Apple software, though you must set AirDrop to â€œEveryone for 10 minutesâ€ on iOS. Itâ€™s finally happened: Quick Share is now compatible with AirDrop ! That means you can finally send and receive files between Android devices and iPhones, iPads, and MacBooks without installing any additional software. Iâ€™m sure many of you are itching to try this out, but how do you know itâ€™s available? Well, for starters, youâ€™ll need a device in the Pixel 10 lineup, as theyâ€™re first in line to receive this new feature â€” other Android devices will get it sometime later. Apart from that, youâ€™ll also need to install a new app to make Quick Share work with AirDrop. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Subaruâ€™s bringing Android Automotive and a Snapdragon chip to the 2026 Outback
items.summary: It's the first Subaru to use Android Automotive for its infotainment system.
items.body: TL;DR Android Automotive is powering next-generation Subaru cars, starting with the 2026 Outback. The Google operating system adds support for Google Assistant and other services without needing a connected smartphone. The Android Automotive-based platform retains compatibility with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay. Many automakers are deciding whether to integrate platforms like Android Auto or Apple CarPlay into their vehicles, or to build their own in-house software. General Motors, for example, is about to ditch Android Auto and CarPlay on its future cars. Then, thereâ€™s Tesla, the company that built a custom infotainment system but is now reportedly considering adding CarPlay anyway. Another wrinkle is Android Automotive, the Google operating system that runs on cars independently of a connected smartphone. Subaru confirmed its next-generation infotainment system will use Android Automotive, supporting Android Auto and CarPlay, and it just shared key details and specs. Subaruâ€™s new infotainment system will feature access to Google services without a connected smartphone, Subaru said in a press release this week (via 9to5Google ). The automaker doesnâ€™t mention Android Auâ€¦

items.title: Smart cameras could be about to get a major upgrade with Matter 1.5
items.summary: DIY smart home lovers just got great news thanks to this protocol update.
items.body: TL;DR Matter is an open smart home protocol for communication between devices. The new Matter 1.5 standard adds support for smart home cameras, opening up new possibilities. New support is also arriving for soil sensors, helping you automate your garden. Are smart home ecosystems at an inflection point right now? This year has already been a frustrating one for Google Home users , and as if those regular usage headaches werenâ€™t bad enough, companies like Google and Amazon have been complicating their smart home offerings with AI-powered subscriptions â€” and sometimes introducing new, unwanted content in the process. Thatâ€™s pushing more and more people to consider a more DIY smart home solution , and today weâ€™ve got great news for anybody going that route. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google made Quick Share compatible with AirDrop without Appleâ€™s help (Update: Confirmed)
items.summary: Android's Quick Share is now compatible with AirDrop thanks to Google, not Apple.
items.body: TL;DR Google has announced that Androidâ€™s Quick Share is now compatible with Apple AirDrop, finally solving the file-sharing divide between the platforms. Apple was not involved in the update, as Google said it built the feature independently to address interoperability issues. Itâ€™s possible Google reverse-engineered AirDropâ€™s technology to make this work, though itâ€™s unclear if Apple will retaliate against the move. Update 1, November 20, 2025 (1:18 PM ET): Google reached out to Android Authority to share a follow-up statement, confirming that it added AirDrop compatibility into Quick Share on its own. Hereâ€™s the statement in full: â€œWe accomplished this through our own implementation. Our implementation was thoroughly vetted by our own privacy and security teams, and we also engaged a third party security firm to pentest the solution.â€

Itâ€™s currently experiencing its first-ever Amazon discount, thanks to the Black Friday sale, and itâ€™s no small markdown â€” the smart ring is available for just $209 today, down from its standard price of $299. This is a significant 30% discount from the RRP. We called this smart ring the best option for a subscription-free experience . With its solid health-tracking capabilities, the RingConn Gen 2 Smart Ring is designed to monitor various indicators like heart rate, SpOâ‚‚, and even sleep trends. Itâ€™s particularly noteworthy for not requiring an app subscription, which can be a money-saver if youâ€™re aiming to keep costs down. The battery life is another highlight, often lasting over ten days per charge â€” making frequent recharges a thing of the past.

items.title: Breaking: Androidâ€™s Quick Share now works with Appleâ€™s AirDrop
items.summary: Pixel 10 owners can now use Quick Share to send files to iPhones seamlessly.
items.body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR Androidâ€™s Quick Share now works with Appleâ€™s AirDrop. The update is rolling out today, initially for the Pixel 10 series. Google says that the interoperability was added with â€œstrong safeguards that were tested by independent security experts.â€ Android makes it incredibly easy to share files between two devices with its Quick Share feature. However, thatâ€™s usually only the case with Android and Windows devices. Thatâ€™s changing today as Google has rolled out an update to Quick Share that allows it to work seamlessly with Appleâ€™s AirDrop. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Chromebooks will now get to skip the line to play games on GeForce NOW
items.summary: No more waiting to play.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google has partnered with NVIDIA to launch GeForce NOW Fast Pass exclusively for Chromebooks. The promotion allows players to skip the queue so they can get right into streaming PC games from their existing libraries. Anyone who buys a Chromebook will get one year of GeForce NOW Fast Pass. Chromebooks arenâ€™t exactly known for their prowess in running video games. However, cloud gaming platforms like NVIDIAâ€™s GeForce NOW can help make the device a more viable option for higher-end gaming. To make the experience even better, Google and NVIDIA are partnering up to provide a new offering. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Gemini starts rolling out to Android Auto users globally: Hereâ€™s everything it can do
items.summary: Gemini promises to act as your driving buddy, answering questions, having live conversations, creating vibes, and more.
items.body: Credit: Google TL;DR Gemini is starting to roll out for Android Auto users worldwide. Google says the rollout will continue over the next couple of months. To get Gemini on Android Auto, users must first upgrade from Google Assistant to Gemini on their phones. Google recommends trying five things when you first get Gemini in Android Auto. After giving beta testers the first taste , Google is now starting to push out Gemini to Android Auto users around the world. While the worldwide rollout is kicking off today, Google says itâ€™ll continue over the next couple of months. Naturally, to get Gemini on Android Auto, users must first upgrade from Google Assistant to Gemini on their phones.

items.title: Stop using the wrong Gemini: The one setting you need to change for Gemini 3
items.summary: Ready to use Gemini 3 Pro? Here's what you need to do.
items.body: Just eight months after Gemini 2.5 launched, Google has upgraded its AI models once again with the release of Gemini 3 . Gemini 3 officially began rolling out widely on November 18, and even this early on, itâ€™s already proving to be wildly impressive. Google is making big promises for Gemini 3, touting that this latest model is much better at understanding complex questions and delivering more concise answers. Gemini 3 can even generate custom UIs in real-time for your prompts, making its answers much more interactive and stylized than ever before. Itâ€™s exciting stuff.

They offer a variety of innovative water filtration solutions, including under-sink and countertop Reverse Osmosis systems, pitchers, and whole-house filters, for homes, offices, and outdoor environments. And this Black Friday, you can take advantage of some great discounts as you invest in your familyâ€™s health by ensuring quick, easy access to fresh, pure, and safe drinking water. Hereâ€™s what you should know.

items.title: I tried Googleâ€™s new Nano Banana Pro, and itâ€™s the AI Photoshop of my dreams
items.summary: Googleâ€™s AI image generation and editing model just got way better, and I was able to take it for a spin.
items.body: In its never-ending quest to defeat OpenAI, Google is trying all sorts of tactics to get people to switch from ChatGPT to Gemini . One of its best weapons in this fight is Nano Banana , Googleâ€™s AI image generation and editing model. It went insanely viral after launch, so Google has leaned hard on it, promoting it on as many platforms as possible. To maintain this momentum, Google has launched Nano Banana Pro, a significantly improved version of its AI image model. I had the opportunity to test this new model prior to launch, and I think itâ€™s going to become a Photoshop replacement for image editing beginners like myself. Iâ€™ve been using the original Nano Banana for a variety of things since it launched in late August. From modifying our existing stock images to seamlessly add new text, to generating eye-catching thumbnails for our Authority Insights Podcast , Nano Banana has been an immensely useful tool for my work. Thereâ€™s no doubt that it does an incredible job at creating and modifying images â€” it wouldnâ€™t have gone viral if it was terrible, after all.

items.title: Nano Banana Pro is here, making Googleâ€™s image model better than ever before
items.summary: The update brings improvements in text generation, element blending, aspect ratio control for better output, and more.
items.body: TL;DR Google has launched Nano Banana Pro, its latest image model, built on Gemini 3 Pro Image. It features state-of-the-art reasoning, excellent legible and multilingual text rendering, and the ability to use real-time data from Google Search. You can try out Nano Banana Pro globally via the Gemini app with quotas based on subscription tiers. Back in August, Google launched Nano Banana , its Gemini 2.5 Flash Image model that went viral for doing a great job with human subjects and making it easier to tweak generated images (mostly). People used it for all sorts of creations, such as making mini-figurines for themselves and restoring old photos. Today, Google is introducing Nano Banana Pro based on Gemini 3 Pro Image, making its image model better than ever before. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Eufyâ€™s E28 robot vacuum is a favorite of ours, and it just got a massive Black Friday price cut

items.body: Credit: Jonathan Feist / Android Authority In a sea of Black Friday robot vacuum deals, the Eufy E28 stands out for more than just the discount. Itâ€™s now $699.99 , down from $999.99, and itâ€™s also the model my colleague Jonathan keeps around specifically for deep-cleaning carpets. Heâ€™s plenty of Eufyâ€™s lineup at home, and the E28 is the one he calls a â€œmopping and deep-clean champ.â€ Part of the appeal is that the E28 isnâ€™t just another vacuum-and-mop combo. The dock hides a detachable FlexiOne deep cleaner, essentially a portable spot-cleaning unit you can grab for carpets, stairs, and fabric messes the robot canâ€™t reach. Itâ€™s an unusual two-in-one setup â€” the robot handles the whole-home route, and the detachable cleaner takes care of the stubborn stuff.

items.title: This cheap Android gaming handheld is my new favorite PSP replacement
items.summary: Excellent upscaled PSP emulation for less than $100.
items.body: When I finished my studies and left my childhood home 15 years ago, the only piece of gaming hardware I brought with me was my PSP. Sonyâ€™s first portable console wasnâ€™t just jam-packed with great games, it also served as my portable media player. In the age of smartphones and streaming services, itâ€™s long been retired, but when I recently dug it out to revisit the memories, I was sad to see that the battery pack had swelled to a dangerous degree. Sure, I could buy a new battery pack, but instead, I moved on to a new handheld that perfectly captures and builds on what made the PSP great.

items.title: Verizon officially announces a major staff cut to help save its sinking ship
items.summary: Verizon has announced major organizational changes, including workforce reductions and retail restructuring.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Verizon has confirmed it will cut over 13,000 jobs and convert 179 corporate-owned stores into franchise locations. The company says the restructuring is meant to reset and realign priorities, backed by a $20 million transition fund for affected employees. These cuts follow roughly 20,000 prior job losses over three years and represent one of the largest single reductions in Verizonâ€™s history. Last week, we learned that both T-Mobile and Verizon were reportedly making some big changes in the near future. While T-Mobile has yet to unveil its news, Verizon has now officially announced its plans, as first noted by Bloomberg and confirmed by Verizon . As it turns out, Big Red is cutting more than 13,000 jobs, and it will also be converting 179 corporate-owned retail stores into franchise locations. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Android may soon sync Airplane Mode between your phone and watch
items.summary: Toggling Airplane Mode on your Android phone will soon toggle it on your Wear OS watch.
items.body: TL;DR Google is developing a new feature that syncs the Airplane Mode state between Android phones and Wear OS watches. A new string we discovered in the 2511 Android Canary build reveals a setting to link the mode across connected devices. When enabled, toggling Airplane Mode on your phone will automatically trigger it on your watch via Bluetooth. Most mobile devices feature a one-tap Airplane Mode that disables wireless radios. While designed to prevent interference with aircraft communications, many people also use the feature on the ground to preserve battery life. Although enabling Airplane Mode is simple, Android phones and Wear OS watches donâ€™t currently sync this state. You must remember to toggle it on both devices individually. If you forget one, your device may needlessly drain its battery searching for a cellular signal at 30,000 feet. To solve this, Google is working on a new setting that syncs Airplane Mode between your devices.

items.title: Fifth meeting of the International Health Regulations (2005) Emergency Committee regarding the upsurge of mpox 2024
items.summary: Concurring with the advice and considerations expressed by the Committee during the meeting, the WHO Director-General, on 5 September 2025, determined that the upsurge of mpox 2024 no longer constitutes a public health emergency of international concern (PHEIC).

items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today released new guidance for countries on ways to counter the immediate and long-term effects of sudden and severe cuts to external funding, which are disrupting the delivery of essential health services in many countries. The new guidance, called â€œResponding â€¦

items.title: WHO calls for a new era of strategic urban health action with global guide to unlock healthy, prosperous and resilient societies
items.summary: With the new guide for decision-makers launched today, WHO provides concrete ideas to usher in a new era of urban health action. The Guide responds to the growing demand for integrated solutions that address health challenges and promote health more broadly in urban settings.

items.title: Climate inaction is claiming millions of lives every year, warns new Lancet Countdown report
items.summary: WHO and global partners are calling for the protection of peopleâ€™s health to be recognized as the most powerful driver of climate action, as a new global report released today warns that continued overreliance on fossil fuels and failure to adapt to a heating world are already having a devastating â€¦

items.title: Fiji becomes the 26th country to eliminate trachoma as a public health problem
items.summary: In a landmark public health achievement, Fiji has been validated by the World Health Organization (WHO) for eliminating trachoma as a public health problem. Trachoma, a neglected tropical disease (NTD) and the worldâ€™s leading infectious cause of blindness, no longer poses a public health threat in â€¦

items.title: WHO and the European Union launch collaboration to advance digitized health systems in sub-Saharan Africa
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) and the European Union (EU) announced today a new agreement to support the digital transformation of health systems and wider adoption of WHOâ€™s Global Digital Health Certification Network (GDHCN) in sub-Saharan Africa. This EUâ€“WHO partnership will improve pandemiâ€¦

items.title: WHO upgrades its public health intelligence system to boost global health security
items.summary: Today, the World Health Organization (WHO), in collaboration with key partners and supporters, launched version 2.0 of the Epidemic Intelligence from Open Sources (EIOS) system, used globally for the early detection of public health threats.

items.title: Maldives becomes the first country to achieve â€˜triple eliminationâ€™ of mother-to-child transmission of HIV, syphilis and hepatitis B
items.summary: In a landmark public health achievement, the World Health Organization (WHO) has validated the Maldives for eliminating mother-to-child transmission (EMTCT) of hepatitis B, while maintaining its earlier validation (in 2019) for EMTCT of HIV and syphilis.

items.title: WHO warns of widespread resistance to common antibiotics worldwide
items.summary: One in six laboratory-confirmed bacterial infections causing common infections in people worldwide in 2023 were resistant to antibiotic treatments, according to a new World Health Organization (WHO) report launched today. Between 2018 and 2023, antibiotic resistance rose in over 40% of the pathogenâ€¦

items.title: 'I deeply hurt people by moving to Saudi Arabia'
items.summary: In an interview with BBC Sport, Ashleigh Plumptre says she regrets losing the trust of some LGBT fans in women's football by moving to Saudi Arabia.

items.title: WHO tobacco trends report: 1 in 5 adults still addicted to tobacco
items.summary: The world is smoking less, but the tobacco epidemic is far from over. A new WHO global report shows the number of tobacco users has dropped from 1.38 billion in 2000 to 1.2 billion in 2024. Since 2010, the number of people using tobacco has dropped by 120 million â€“ a 27% drop in relative terms. Yetâ€¦

items.title: Global health agencies issue new recommendations to help end deaths from postpartum haemorrhage
items.summary: Through landmark new guidelines released today, leading reproductive health agencies are calling for a major shift in how postpartum haemorrhage (PPH) is prevented, diagnosed and treated. The recommendations highlight the urgent need for earlier detection and faster intervention â€“ steps that could â€¦

items.title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
items.summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

items.title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
items.summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.
